title: Pontifical Academy of Social Sciences
text:
The Pontifical Academy of Social Sciences (, or PASS) was established on 1 January 1994 by <a href="Pope%20John%20Paul%20II">Pope John Paul II</a> and is headquartered in the <a href="Casina%20Pio%20IV">Casina Pio IV</a> in <a href="Vatican%20City">Vatican City</a>. It operates much like other <a href="learned%20society">learned societies</a> worldwide, but has the special task of entering into dialogue with the Church. Its scientific activities are organised and focused to promote this dialogue.
History.
PASS is one of the ten <a href="pontifical%20academy">pontifical academies</a> at the Vatican in Rome. It was established to promote the study of <a href="social%20sciences">social sciences</a>, primarily <a href="economics">economics</a>, <a href="sociology">sociology</a>, <a href="law">law</a>, and <a href="political%20science">political science</a>. Through appropriate dialogue it offers the <a href="Roman%20Catholic%20Church">Roman Catholic Church</a> elements useful to the development of its <a href="Catholic%20social%20teaching">social teaching</a>, and it reflects on the application of that doctrine in contemporary society. PASS, which is autonomous, maintains a close relationship with the <a href="Pontifical%20Council%20for%20Justice%20and%20Peace">Pontifical Council for Justice and Peace</a>.
French economist <a href="Edmond%20Malinvaud">Edmond Malinvaud</a> was the first president of the academy, from 1994 to 2000. In April 2014, <a href="Pope%20Francis">Pope Francis</a> appointed British sociologist <a href="Margaret%20Archer">Margaret Archer</a> to the post. On 27 March 2019 she was replaced by Prof. <a href="Stefano%20Zamagni">Stefano Zamagni</a>.
PASS is headquartered in the <a href="Casina%20Pio%20IV">Casina Pio IV</a> in the heart of the <a href="Vatican%20Gardens">Vatican Gardens</a> along with its sister academy, the <a href="Pontifical%20Academy%20of%20Sciences">Pontifical Academy of Sciences</a>. The Chancellor of both academies is Monsignor <a href="Marcelo%20S%C3%A1nchez%20Sorondo">Marcelo Sánchez Sorondo</a>.
